title: Sam Bankman-Fried Used $100 Million in Stolen Cash for Political Donations, DOJ Alleges
description: The Justice Department claims the disgraced crypto mogul used client funds to “influence cryptocurrency regulation.”

title: FDIC Highlights 'Novel and Complex' Crypto Risks in Annual Review
description: It was the first time the bank regulator dedicated a section to digital assets in its regular risk report.

title: Sam Bankman-Fried charged with fraudulent campaign donations exceeding $100M
description:
Sam Bankman-Fried, the founder and former CEO of FTX, is now facing charges of illegal campaign financing activity, per superseding indictment filed Aug. 14. The prosecutor’s filing alleges that Bankman-Fried contributed more than $100 million to Democratic and Republican campaigns with the intention of influencing cryptocurrency regulation. Those funds were supposedly drawn from customer deposits. […]

The post Sam Bankman-Fried charged with fraudulent campaign donations exceeding $100M appeared first on CryptoSlate.

title: Cardano’s $ADA Could See Massive 2,900% Price Increase if History Repeats Itself: Analyst
description: Popular cryptocurrency analyst Ali Martinez has recently pointed out that the price of smart contract platform Cardano ($ADA) could soon surge over 2,900% if history is to repeat itself, as previous periods of relative stability for the token have been followed by huge price explosions. title: FTX’s Bankman-Fried (SBF) needs vital medications in prison
description: FTX’s Sam Bankman-Fried is amidst a pressing situation during his detention. As first revealed by Reuters, the founder of the beleaguered cryptocurrency firm urgently needs access to his depression and ADHD medications while in custody. His lawyers made a resolute plea on Monday to ensure these medical essentials are delivered ahead of his imminent fraud ... Read more

title: SBF can’t catch a break: Indicted on new charges
description: SBF, the notorious founder of the now-defunct cryptocurrency exchange FTX, is under fire once again. New indictments allege that he pilfered over $100 million in customer funds, which were later funneled into political campaign contributions in the lead-up to the 2022 U.S. midterm elections. The drama surrounding SBF seems to intensify with every passing day, ... Read more
